derivation: probably from G3700 (ὄφις) (through the idea of sharpness of vision);
strongs_def: a snake, figuratively, (as a type of sly cunning) an artful malicious person, especially Satan
outline:
1. snake, serpent
  2. with the ancients, the serpent was an emblem of cunning and wisdom. The serpent who deceived Eve was regarded by the Jews as the devil.
